subject: Politics
title: Impeachment
description: A quick, practical guide to Impeachment.

hook.text: Only three US presidents have been impeached. Impeachment is democracy's emergency brake â€” rarely used but vital.

buildup.text: Impeachment is the process of charging a leader with misconduct. It's a political trial, not a criminal one.

discovery.text: South Korea impeached and removed President Park Geun-hye in 2017 for corruption. The system worked.

twist.text: Impeachment is political. Partisan loyalty can protect guilty leaders. No US president has been removed by impeachment.

climax.text: The threat of impeachment matters even when it fails. It forces public debate about abuse of power.

punchline.text: Impeachment is democracy's last resort. It works when credible, not partisan.

quiz.question: Which country successfully impeached and removed its president for corruption in 2017?
